programme.desc: Officers are on the lookout for day-trippers trying to smuggle prescription pills into America, bought cheaply from one of the 200 pharmacies on the other side of the border.

programme.title: Guy Martin: Proper Jobs
programme.desc: Firefighter: Guy follows in the footsteps of his brother and sister when he trains to become a firefighter in some scarily real environments at a fire station in Grimsby.

programme.title: Rick Stein's Long Weekends
programme.desc: Bordeaux: Rick Stein embarks on a series of culinary long weekends in search of food excellence and brilliant recipes - he begins his adventures in autumnal Bordeaux.

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: Somerset: Savvy bargain hunters vie for the cost-effective clutter in-cider number of storage lots in Somerset. The gang compete for a Velcro bouncy castle and an airboat.

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: Caxton: 'Lots' of fraught auction antics in the riotous reality series. Heavy D risks having his fingers burned. New boys Glyn and James rub the old guard up the wrong way.

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: Leeds: Sean Kelly starts the bidding in the uber-popular reality series. A new duo are in town and they aren't afraid to throw their weight around. Sam and Ione clash again.

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: Ipswich: Auction anarchy in the UK. Heavy D is doing what he does best and driving the others mad. Nat, Linda, Boudicca and Ione may have to team up to beat the Boominator!

programme.title: Our Guy in China
programme.desc: Yangtze River: Guy Martin builds his own electric motorbike in a factory in Chongqing before visiting the world's biggest public toilet and heading along the Yangtze towards Shanghai.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy, Richard and James test and rate the latest cars on the market - well, maybe not quite the latest now. Actor Rupert Grint and F1 star Rubens Barrichello hit the track.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The lads try to build cool and interesting motorhomes before setting off for a bank holiday weekend in the West Country. What can go wrong? Actor Andy Garcia takes to the track.

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers' Asian Adventure
programme.desc: Hong Kong: The Hairy Bikers are back, touring the birthplaces of favourite Asian cuisines. In Hong Kong they discover the secrets of wok chi at a street food stall.

programme.title: Rick Stein's Long Weekends
programme.desc: Reykjavik: Rick Stein embarks on a series of culinary long weekends in search of food excellence - in this episode, Rick enjoys a winter break in Reykjavik in search of the perfect cod.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Trumped-up tales and uncomfortable truths in the humorous panel show! The little liars joining Rob Brydon and co are Matt Dawson, Mel Giedroyc, Josh Widdicombe and Dermot O'Leary.

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: New. Gardening expert Diarmuid Gavin, antiques guru Roo Irvine, comedian John Kearns and musician Claire Richards compete to win the Pointless friend's sought-after trophy.

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Richard poses more questions to former winners Rick Edwards, Scarlett Moffatt, Naga Munchetty and David O'Doherty.

programme.desc: The Heat Is Off. As summer's end approaches, Shawn claws closer to the top of the gold count. And, Emily leaves her unpredictable father to tend on the Eroica. S9, Ep10

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: Cornelia Marie Blue. Opilio season starts with the return of the fabled Cornelia Marie. Now, Josh Harris has bought back the boat that helped make his old man a legend. S10, Ep8

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: Skipper Harris in Training. Blood is spilled on the Cape Caution, when a brutal storm rips across the Bering Sea. Then, Sig fights to keep the Northwestern from going up in flames. S10, Ep9

programme.title: Building Alaska
programme.desc: Emergency Supply Run. The builders make progress on their Alaskan jobs but must overcome a catastrophe involving a 1,000-pound ridge beam and a supply shortage. S6, Ep6

programme.title: Building Off The Grid

programme.title: Building Off The Grid

programme.desc: Hard Road Home. Family and friends endure unexpected adversity, as Otto and Charlotte's urgent rescue mission to Halibut Cove brings jeopardy on the seas. S5, Ep11

programme.title: Alaska: The Last Frontier
programme.desc: A Very Kilcher Christmas. Christmas is coming and the Kilchers make homemade gifts for their loved ones, including an explosive gift, a musical present and a dual-use vehicle. S5, Ep12

programme.desc: Living On The Edge. The Raney family begin their most ambitious rescue ever. Marty attempts a dangerous river crossing to get expensive gear to the homestead. S1, Ep1

programme.title: Homestead Rescue: Raney Ranch
programme.desc: One If By River, Two If By Air. Helicopter pilot Eric battles dangerous weather conditions on an aerial supply mission. Plus, Misty and Maciah work on an innovative greenhouse. S1, Ep2

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: The Lucky Day. Sweltering temperatures and a waterlogged mine threaten to unravel The Digi Diggers' season-long dream. The Cheals' starter motor fails on their wash plant. S6, Ep20

programme.desc: Bart After Dark: Bart gets a job at a burlesque theatre. Several residents are keen customers, but others aren't happy to have the showgirls peddling their wares in Springfield.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: A Milhouse Divided: When Milhouse's parents split up, his mum gets together with an American Gladiator called Pyro, his dad self-produces an album and Milhouse goes a bit crazy.

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: An Entrepreneurialist and a Swat on the Bottom: Meemaw refuses to drive Sheldon to a lecture. Georgie attempts to impress Veronica with his new business venture.

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: Hobbitses, Physicses and a Ball with Zip: Sheldon must take a break from science when his new obsession with The Lord of the Rings leads to an unhealthy habit.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Career Day: Phil is chuffed to share the wonders of residential real estate with Luke and Manny's classmates for career day, but unfortunately his nemesis, Gil Thorpe, shows up.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: My Hero: Mitch's ex Teddy, a very personable and successful doctor, invites the family to a fundraising event at the local roller rink, where they all run rings around each other.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Yard Sale: Jay and Gloria hold a yard sale for Manny and Luke's school charity fundraiser. Manny finds an old trunk that hides a secret that Gloria wants to keep under wraps.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Re-entry Minimization: Howard is disappointed when he doesn't receive a hero's welcome on his return from space. Will he ever get the recognition he deserves?

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Holographic Excitation: The gang celebrate Halloween with a fancy dress party at Stuart's comic book shop, but Sheldon and Amy can't agree on which costumes to wear.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Extract Obliteration: Sheldon is thrilled when Stephen Hawking agrees to play against him in an online game. Penny signs up for a class at the community college.

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: Contracts, Rules and a Little Bit of Pig Brains: George Sr and Georgie go camping with Meemaw's new man, but things get complicated when her ex-boyfriend tags along.

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: A Slump, a Cross and Roadside Gravel: Sheldon and Georgie mine for platinum. And Mary is concerned when Missy misuses religion to help with a batting slump.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: ClosetCon '13: Jay begrudgingly returns to ClosetCon, and things get interesting when he's reunited with some old colleagues. Cam takes Mitch and Lily to the Tucker family farm.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: The Big Game: With a big football game coming up and a record to break, Coach Cam is intensely focused and showing no mercy, even when the opposition are at a disadvantage.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer's Phobia: Homer's preconceptions surface when Bart befriends a gay shop owner (guest star John Waters), and he decides to take Bart hunting, but it doesn't go to plan.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Brother from Another Series: Sideshow Bob (guest star Kelsey Grammer) is once again released from prison, into the care of his respectable brother Cecil (David Hyde Pierce).

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Closet Reconfiguration: When Howard and Bernadette get Sheldon to organise their untidy closet, Sheldon finds an unopened letter from Howard's long-absent father.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Tenure Turbulence: Leonard, Sheldon, Raj and Kripke all compete for the same vacancy at the university.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Closure Alternative: Amy employs a series of exercises to cure Sheldon of his compulsion to complete every task without fail and seek closure for every incident.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: The Princess Guide: Homer chaperones a Nigerian princess while her father negotiates a uranium deal with Mr Burns. He takes her to Moe's bar, where Moe begins to fall for her.

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Darren's desperate call for help incites panic throughout the village, but will anyone get there in time? Elsewhere, Ste faces heartbreak in more ways than one.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: The Serfsons: In a fantasy world, the peasant Simpsons struggle with Marge's mother's illness. And Lisa's magic powers lead to her capture.

programme.title: New: Below Deck Down Under
programme.desc: Brand new series - Floating Circus: The charter guests are still on edge with each other, a new stew captivates the deck team, and a surprise kiss threatens to ruin a party.

programme.title: Celebrity Gogglebox
programme.desc: What do Nicole Appleton, Mel Blatt, Shaun Ryder, Bez, Chris Kamara, Example, Professor Green, Chris Eubank Sr, Chris Eubank Jr and other famous faces think of our top telly?

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: Britain's sharpest armchair critics have been watching Line of Duty, Naked Attraction, I Can See Your Voice, Alan Carr's Epic Gameshow and BBC News (Prince Philip).

programme.desc: ...Interview Special: Tom Cruise, Rebecca Ferguson, Henry Cavill, Simon Pegg, Vanessa Kirby and director Christopher McQuarrie talk about making the sixth instalment in the thriller series.

programme.title: The Assembly
programme.desc: Footballer-turned-presenter Gary Lineker gets the grilling of a lifetime as he faces questions from autistic and learning-disabled interviewers, asking if he was forced out by the BBC and who the worst person he has worked with is. From the Hand of God to his first love, no question is off the table and no subject out of bounds when it comes to the Assembly's line of enquiry - expect revelations, chaos, and a lot of laughs

programme.title: For the Love of Dogs with Alison Hammond
programme.desc: TV presenter Katie Piper drops in to Battersea to check out a litter of puppies abandoned with their mother and a homesick bichon frise gets a kennel makeover. Turkish kangal Minnie needs help conquering her fear of weighing scales

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Gary Barlow's Food and Wine Tour: Australia
programme.desc: As Take That return to Australia for the first time in 30 years, Gary Barlow discovers more about the local food and wine. He also reveals why he is now so personally connected to life Down Under, and is joined by a host of celebrity friends

programme.title: In for a Penny
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern heads to Liverpool for the game show in which he travels around the UK setting members of the public unusual challenges, giving them the chance to win anything from the price of their petrol to £1,000 in the final game.

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: James is joined in the kitchen of his Hampshire home by Rob and Dave Nicholson from Springtime on the Farm and chefs Richard Bertinet, Claude Bosi, and John Hooker.

programme.title: Katie Piper's Weekend Escape
programme.desc: Join Katie in her self-built space as she and Russell Watson learn Muay Thai with Love Island's Kaz Crossley while hairdresser Michael Douglas transforms another charity founder.

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Love Your Weekend with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Joining Alan at Manor Farm are Mark Gatiss and Patsy Kensit, while there is an update on trainee guide dog Titch and a celebration of the British classic car. Farrier Sam Wolfenden provides another masterclass, and there is a catch-up with the staff of the Folly Wildlife Centre

programme.title: Alan Titchmarsh's Gardening Club
programme.desc: Garden designer Lucy Willcox offers practical planting design tips for spring, while Camilla Bassett-Smith explores the history and horticulture of an Arts and Crafts garden in the Midlands. Meanwhile, Errol Reuben Fernandes heads to London to help a community green space plant its first-ever micro forest

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Jeremy Pang's Hong Kong Kitchen
programme.desc: The chef goes on a culinary trip to Hong Kong, with celebrity friends joining him to delve into the heart of Cantonese culture and its world-famous gastronomy. His companion for the first instalment is Mel Giedroyc, with the pair taking in the sights, sampling a variety of street food and ending at one of Hong Kong's institutions for the best dim sum in town

programme.title: In for a Penny
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts the game show in which he travels around the UK setting members of the public unusual challenges. Bizarre new game Flush or Float is showcased, before the host takes a trip to Milton Keynes to give away £1,000 via In for a Penny, In for a Grand

programme.title: How to Train Your Dragon
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure featuring the voices of Jay Baruchel and Gerard Butler. A teenage Viking boy forms a special bond with a dragon - much to the consternation of the members of his clan who regard the beasts as mortal enemies.

programme.title: From Russia with Love
programme.desc: Spy adventure starring Sean Connery. James Bond is sent to Istanbul to help a Russian defect to the West with an important cipher machine. However, he is unaware that he is being drawn into a trap laid by criminal organisation Spectre.

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Celebrity Catchphrase
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts another charity edition of the game show, with Mel Blatt, Michelle Visage and Seann Walsh trying to say what they see as they guess well-known phrases for the chance to win a £50,000 jackpot for their chosen good causes

programme.title: Who Wants to Be a Millionaire?
programme.desc: Another line-up of contestants answer questions that could change their lives - with the four lifelines Ask the Audience, Phone a Friend, 50-50 and Ask the Host available to them if they get stuck. Jeremy Clarkson hosts

programme.title: Code of Silence
programme.desc: Alison's informant work grows riskier as she secretly follows Braden and Liam to a building site, where she learns that the gang need an insider to access the vault. As the police eventually identify the gang's target as billionaire Amir Joshi, Alison discovers a fact about her and Julie's looming eviction that pushes her to become increasingly conflicted about her bond with Liam

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: The Taking of Pelham 123
programme.desc: Denzel Washington and John Travolta star in this remake of the 1974 thriller. An armed gang holds passengers on a New York subway train hostage, and threatens to start killing them unless they receive a huge ransom. As the minutes tick by, the tense situation becomes a battle of wits between gang leader "Ryder" and train dispatcher Walter Garber.

programme.title: Alan Titchmarsh's Gardening Club
programme.desc: Camilla Bassett-Smith explores a historic Scottish palace and gardens, Henry Agg builds a DIY pergola, Martha Swales offers a special allotment tour with her dad, and Errol Reuben Fernandes visits a unique Berkshire garden

programme.title: Jeopardy!
programme.desc: Stephen Fry hosts the unique quiz as new players Sarah and Anthony hope that they have what it takes to usurp the reigning Jeopardy! champion and claim the title for themselves.

programme.title: Deal or No Deal: Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts as 2023 King of the Jungle Sam Thompson tries to open the 22 red boxes in the right order, taking on the infamous banker for the chance to win a cash prize for charity. Sam is supported in the wings by friends, family and a few famous faces, including former I'm a Celebrity campmates

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast

programme.title: ITV Evening News
programme.desc: A round-up of the day's news headlines and talking points from the UK and around the world

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Ortis Deley, Maggie Aderin-Pocock, Graeme Hall and Sarah Millican pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: It's John and Aaron's wedding day - as John is tormented by nightmares, Ross orchestrates a plan

programme.title: Code of Silence
programme.desc: Alison is invited on a lavish trip to a luxurious hotel with Liam and soon discovers that he is using her as cover to spy on Amir Joshi and his family. She is convinced she can walk the fine line between her duty to the police and their undeniable connection, but she wavers when Liam opens up about his troubled past and she realises she is falling in love

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: Twisted Twins
programme.desc: Police officers in Atlanta, USA investigate the brutal murder of Nikki Whitehead in her own home in January 2010 only to find their investigation leads them to her identical twin daughters Jasmiyah and Tasmiyah

programme.title: Joanna Lumley's Danube
programme.desc: The actress and presenter travels down the famous river, beginning in Germany's Black Forest. She explores the Danube Gorge in Bavaria, and meets memorable characters, including a beer-brewing nun. In Austria. Joanna also discovers the beauty of the Wachau wine valley and fulfils a dream to visit the Vienna Boys Choir, before Tom Neuwirth, also known as Eurovision winner Conchita Wurst - reveals more of Vienna

programme.title: James Martin's Midweek Menu
programme.desc: James cooks with some Middle White pork from a farm in Somerset, tastes pork pies from chef Nokx Majozi, demonstrates how to make butter in another masterclass and serves up a fruit roulade for guests Jenni Falconer and John McGuinness with a little help from chefs John Hooker, Paul Ainsworth, and Mark Birchall

programme.title: Jeopardy!
programme.desc: Stephen Fry introduces new contestants Emily and Dean as they aim to overcome the returning Jeopardy! champion and go home with the ultimate quiz show title.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Sam from Telford, Lucie from Surrey, Betty from Hayling Island and Gary from Leeds pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast

programme.title: ITV Evening News
programme.desc: A round-up of the day's news headlines and talking points from the UK and around the world

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: It is the wedding day and John is tormented by secrets and nightmares. Sarah goes to get her biopsy results alone

programme.title: Love Your Garden
programme.desc: In Enfield, north London, Alan Titchmarsh and his team transform a garden for Yvonne, a woman who has devoted her life to combatting knife crime after the death of her son who was tragically murdered when he was just 17-years-old. Alan's design is all about the garden becoming a healing space, where Yvonne can remember her son, and where the family can come together again. Elsewhere, Katie Rushworth learns just how healing nature can be at the Cascades Gardens in Derbyshire.

programme.title: Ellie Simmonds: Should I Have Children?
programme.desc: The former Paralympic swimmer sets out to discover how attitudes towards disabled children have changed in the 30 years since her birth and what her genetic condition could mean for her as she looks forward to starting a family. She meets with expectant parents who have received a disability diagnosis for their unborn baby and learns how parents are supported when confronted with this life-changing news

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: Scotland Tonight
programme.desc: Current affairs programme delving into stories beyond the headlines. Featuring live studio debates and comprehensive analysis, it sheds light on key stories impacting the nation and its surroundings

programme.title: The Jonathan Ross Show
programme.desc: The host welcomes restaurateur Gordon Ramsay, actor Danny Dyer, stage and screen star Vanessa Williams, 2024 Sports Personality of the Year Keely Hodgkinson and star of Babygirl Harris Dickinson to his sofa. Plus, a performance by singer-songwriter Joan Armatrading

programme.title: Jaws: The Revenge
programme.desc: Action adventure starring Lorraine Gary and featuring Michael Caine. Amity has not suffered a shark attack in years, but the fears of widow Ellen Brody resurface when her younger son is suddenly killed. Believing the entire family is somehow threatened, she flies to the Bahamas to warn her marine biologist son, Michael, of the danger. Meanwhile, also heading for the warmer waters is something big, hungry and out for revenge.

programme.title: Jeopardy!

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Ortis Deley, Maggie Aderin-Pocock, Graeme Hall and Sarah Millican pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: Emmerdale

programme.title: Code of Silence
programme.desc: Alison is invited on a lavish trip to a luxurious hotel with Liam and soon discovers that he is using her as cover to spy on Amir Joshi and his family. programme.title: Twisted Twins
programme.desc: Police officers in Atlanta, USA investigate the brutal murder of Nikki Whitehead in her own home in January 2010 only to find their investigation leads them to her identical twin daughters Jasmiyah and Tasmiyah

programme.title: Joanna Lumley's Danube
programme.desc: The actress and presenter travels down the famous river, beginning in Germany's Black Forest. She explores the Danube Gorge in Bavaria, and meets memorable characters, including a beer-brewing nun. In Austria. Joanna also discovers the beauty of the Wachau wine valley and fulfils a dream to visit the Vienna Boys Choir, before Tom Neuwirth, also known as Eurovision winner Conchita Wurst - reveals more of Vienna

programme.title: Love Your Garden
programme.desc: In Enfield, north London, Alan Titchmarsh and his team transform a garden for Yvonne, a woman who has devoted her life to combatting knife crime after the death of her son who was tragically murdered when he was just 17-years-old. Alan's design is all about the garden becoming a healing space, where Yvonne can remember her son, and where the family can come together again. Elsewhere, Katie Rushworth learns just how healing nature can be at the Cascades Gardens in Derbyshire.

programme.title: Ellie Simmonds: Should I Have Children?
programme.desc: The former Paralympic swimmer sets out to discover how attitudes towards disabled children have changed in the 30 years since her birth and what her genetic condition could mean for her as she looks forward to starting a family. She meets with expectant parents who have received a disability diagnosis for their unborn baby and learns how parents are supported when confronted with this life-changing news
